body: Wag chicken dry food made my 3 dogs sick I had 2 large farm dogs & one fat chigle. All are seniors. None are picky but I try & feed the 14 yr old (beagle/chihuahua) a small breed better quality food. Bought the Wag, beef type the first time. It was enjoyed by all. The next round I got chicken Wag.  I didn't really blame the food on the sickness, my old Spaniel got listless, then she was hardly getting around, then had a stroke & then put to sleep! This was a 2 week time span. The Chigle was throwing up every day... (And he is a napkin eater with a goats constitution) and he isn't wanting to eat it... So I let big Betty have some, & after a couple days she won't eat it. (Remarkable bc she eats road kill if no body is watching). So I have an entire 30# bag that will become fertilizer. Im sorry I didn't investigate the food further, I just never thought to blame it... Until Betty wouldn't eat it. The Spaniel we put to sleep was her mother, 14 years old. Betty is 12, and they had never been apart, so her listlessness I chalked up to depression. 😫 No more Wag for us, before I run out of waggers!

body: Poor quality food I’ve worked in the animal industry for 20 years and and very familiar with dog food and the way dogs digest there food. I was low on money and tried this food. Usually my dog eats great quality food. She normally poops 1-2 times a day and the stools are small and firm. Smaller and firmer stool= your pet is absorbing and digesting most of the nutrients of the food they are ingesting. After feeding her this garbage food(same portions as previous quality food) she was defecating 2-3 times a day and they were huuuge stools. Thus, this food has too many fillers and little nutrients. For the sake of you pup. For them to be happier, healthier, live a long life, just spend a few more bucks to get better quality food than this garbage. This is literally by far the worst quality food I’ve ever seen, except for maybe Alpo. Amazon should not be creating budget friendly dog food and should  be ashamed.

body: Good Quality Dry Dog Food. My rather picky, 4yo female American Pit Bull Terrier loves it! Before this she was on some Rachel Ray Grain Free dry dog food. For whatever reason she did not like the last Rachel Ray Grain Free Dog food, so when I found that she LOVES this Wag Dry Dog Food I threw away ~1/2 a big bag of the Rachel Ray Grain Free Dog food, I think I am going to go ahead and stop giving her grain free dog food. So yeah, no more grain free for Stella. So far she loves this WAG dry dog food, so if she completes this bag then I am sure I will buy some more when it goes on sale again.

body: Concerns About Food but Overall Solid My dog Scooby has severe allergies. He gets lots of ear infections and other stuff leading to our vet to believe he's allergic to Beef, Chicken, and Lamb. Fortunately, this salmon dog food brand does not give him ear allergies to date. I have personally ordered many bags ahead of time since my dog seems to overall enjoy it.Yet, I have seen what others have experienced with this brand. My dog sometimes throws up after eating this food a few hours later but usually it is a yellow bile. Reading online I found out that this means my dog's stomach is empty so for whatever reason his body must process this food at a much more rapid pace than other previously used brands. We have resolved this issue by simply splitting his meals across the day so his stomach is at ease.Overall, I found my dog was not allergic to food. Yet, I'm still kind of skeptical that he's "processing" the food much quicker than other brands. Not sure if this is because it has less fillers and/or it's less "pure".Note: We previously bought Pedigree Steak and Chicken (prior to his allergies) then shifted him to Kirkland Signature Lamb dog food

body: Terrible! Made both dogs ill. We subscribed to this food a while back. At first, the food was quality and you could tell that it was similar to other more expensive brands. However, we have witnessed the decline in quality over the months. So much so that the kibble pieces turn in to a dust almost, which you can see in other posts. The last batch we opened and when we gave it to our dogs they sniffed it but wouldn’t eat it. I thought it odd but I decided they weren’t hungry at the time or stressed out because we just moved. They ended up eating it and almost immediately became ill. Like, violently ill. Vomiting and diarrhea all over our new place. We had just moved and they were stressed, so I thought it might be that and didn’t account for the food because it was the same food we had been giving them for months. To make a 3+ week  story short, we had to take them to the vet and after all types of expensive testing, back and forth visits, they determined it had to be because of the food. After reading the other reviews about other dogs becoming ill, I can agree. We changed their food to the doggie brat diet (pumpkin, rice and chicken) and we are now slowly introducing another brand of kibble. They are now much better, but I’d use my expensive and stressful experience and buy another brand. I have also contacted customer service so that other dogs do not become ill like ours.
subject: Amazon Brand – Wag Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 5 lb Bag

body: Very impressed and Maverick likes it!  Stick with GRAINS!!! Wow, I am very impressed with Amazon's Wag Beef dog food.  We always buy salmon or chicken but Maverick loved the beef.  We also like that it has grains as we are trying to avoid grain free dog foods since they are associated with DCM, a canine heart disease known as taurine-deficient dilated cardiomyopathy.  Taurine has also been added, as well as Glucosamine, but not chondroitin.  The ingredient list is impressive, there is no by product meal, corn, soy or wheat.  The kibble barely smells, and the size is good for medium to large breed, not really for toy or tiny breeds. Packaged in a not so fancy bag and with no zip lock feature on the small bag:( The chicken is priced even more reasonable.  I think this food is a great deal, with great ingredients at a great price. Maverick the retriever had no stomach issues and likes the food, we will consider purchasing again.  Its made in the USA and its rate 4.5 out of 5 stars on DogFoodAdvisor.  Again, I am recommending the Wag Wholesome Grain dog food, not the grain free!

body: VOMIT! DO NOT BUY! Please listen to all the reviews on this like I should have done. I got it because it was dirt cheap on a prime day sale and my poor pup paid the price. body: Try just one bag first before signing up for Subscribe and Save. I ordered this product because I own two breeds that are susceptible to diet induced skin allergies (Rottweiler and lab).  I read how it was difficult on the gut for them to transition.  Lots of dogs experienced diarrhea and vomiting if the owners rushed the transition in diet.  I signed up anyhow as the price was right for an ultra-healthy dog food.  Turns out not only did it give them gas and the runs and the occasional vomiting, but it also smells very unpleasant right out of the bag and it's all I could do to coax them into eating it.  After my subscribe and save orders were stacking up and they still weren't thrill to eat.  I eventually cancelled all further deliveries and changed brands.  Results are better now but I'm stuck with about 45 pounds of the old brand.  I plan on donating it to my local vet in case he is aware of anyone with a dog that is so desperately prone to allergies that they may wish to try this product.  It's no good for our household but I'm still sure it's a worthy product for the right dog.

body: Price Is A Bit High and Not Enough Nutritional Value For Pitbulls Hi, it’s Glamorous it’s Glamorous Gem, hope you all are having a beautiful day,What I Like:Tiny Pieces Makes It Easier To Chew For Fast EatersNo Weird Smell or Anything Found In Dog FoodHas Everyday Essential VitaminsNo Fillers or By ProductsReal Meat compared To ProcessedNo Stomach Upset or Change In StoolEasy To DigestWhat I Don’t Like:Not Enough B Vitamins and Omega 3s (Which Are Essential For My Dogs Diet)Not Enough ProteinPrice Is A Bit High For Less FoodMore Secondary Ingredients Despite It Being No FillersAnyway, my pit bull mix has never been a picky eater per se, but his diet does comes with its restrictions of having no by products or corn in his diet. Which is very hard not to find in most dog food nowadays. Though, even though he’s currently on Purina One’s True Instinct, it’s always good to look for cheaper alternatives. So, why not try this?This of course has no corn, no by product meal, no wheat or soy. Includes whole grains, promotes healthy digestion, immunity, and has probiotics and fiber. While real American beef is the first ingredient.What I like about it immediately is the size of the kibble isn’t too large. Even though I have a large dog, he still eats too fast to process big food well. So smaller pieces does him quite well. They are merely tiny discs so that makes it super easy forhim to chew and not choke. There was also was no change in his feces unlike other brands that make his stool loose as well.Another thing I like is it doesn’t have any weird smell to it. The smell of the dog food is very mild if not unnoticeable. So, you can’t really smell any fillers in there.This dog food is also very rich in essential vitamins. Like Zinc, Crude Fat, Crude Protein, Vitamin E, and a few others for overall digestive and overall health. So, it definitely provides enough energy for the average dog.But, there are some thing that I don’t like about this brand already. They don’t have nearly enough B vitamins as well as vitamin A, C, and E for my dogs diet. He requires a lot of B vitamins and omega 3 fatty acids because of his skin conditions. So, this has little to none which really doesn’t help his skin or coat.Secondly, the price just doesn’t do it for me. I paid nearly $43 for my dogs food for a 40lb bag. This is $38 and it doesn’t include nearly enough protein or the vitamins he needs to repair his ailments. Not to mention, 10lbs of dogs food definitely makes a difference when I only have to buy him ONE BAG Per MONTH.  He would need another two bags to make up the difference of his other food.I’m glad my dog likes the taste of this food and I didn’t see anything strange in it as well. BUT, I can’t see myself switching to a brand like this because of my dog breeds limitations. Though, this would be perfect for dogs that just require smaller amounts of everyday nutrition. Otherwise, not the best choice for me.PS: No matter the nature, I only write honest, unbiased, and authentic reviews.Thanks for reading:)

body: Decent Dog Food, Not as Good as Grain-Free Version This is a decent dog food, with protein at or near the top of the list. body: Chemicals listed ! Sodium Selenite ! This dog food came as a recommended brand on my Amazon account. Theres currently a deal going on that intrigued me. Sodium selenite, after a quick Google search this is what I found "There is a common ingredient present in most pet foods that can be very damaging to the health of your dog or cat, even though it is present in very minute amounts: sodium selenite (NaSeO3). ... It may be toxic to blood, kidneys, liver, skin, central nervous system of your pet." After reading through other reviews it appears some peoples dogs have got ill, now that obviously could be a sensitivity but it also could be from this ingredient. . . I won't be purchasing as I don't understand the need for this ingredient.

body: 2 SICK DOGS I don't know if this was just a bad batch or not, but after reading other reviews from December 2020 onwards, I'm starting to think this is just a bad brand. We have been buying this for the 8-12 months for our dogs and NEVER had a problem with it. However, with the bag we purchased a few weeks ago, they have been sick/throwing up for the past few days and been VERY low-energy/just want to be alone. Both our dogs are usually high-energy (2.5 year old queens-land heeler and a corgi) and LOVE to cuddle. While I don't want to definitively say that people should not buy this brand, I will not be since this is literally the only thing that could cause my dogs to be sick and acting this way (we don't have any chemicals in the house, only use pet-friendly cleaners that get put away after every use, don't let them out unmonitored so they can't eat/get into anything bad outside, bring their own water and bowl to the park so they don't share with other dogs...).

body: Made our dogs violently ill. Worst dog food ever. Put us though a huge scare. We have 2 small dogs and they started vomiting shortly after starting on this dog food. We’re not just talking a little vomiting... repetitive vomiting.So we discontinued use disappointed and worried that it could have long term effects. For a week after our dogs had swollen lymph glands and still weren’t acting 100% normal.Yesterday morning I was half asleep and dumped food out of our food container with spout and went on my way. That’s when the vomiting started again. I had forgotten that we had a new replacement food that was in a bag and not switched out yet.I was so disappointed in myself for forgetting, but even more disappointed in the company that could make a food like this and that AMAZON claims this brand.We had tried the WAG chicken jerkey about a year or so ago and my dogs literally wouldn’t eat it so it went in the garbage.If you are sitting there thinking “What’s one bad review when this food is so cheap and well marketed?”Think again.We are thankful to still have our pups not to mention thousands of dollars in vet bills we could have accrued if we had continued feeing them this dreadful food.

body: My dogs gave it 4 paws down... With 3 rescued greyhounds, keeping them well-fed & healthy is not cheap. Luckily for me they are not picky & will pretty much eat anything I give them & I’ve never tried a food they wouldn’t eat so I generally mix the least expensive quality dry food and wet foods for their meals. Some combos they seem to like more than others, but they have never NOT wanted to eat any of them. Until I tried Wag. I was psyched since it had quality ingredients & it was a heckuvalot cheaper than anything else, so I ordered sample bags of 2 flavors to try. They all usually gobble up their food at meal times, however no matter what I mixed either of the Wag with, they wouldn’t touch it. I even tried mixing it with another dry food and apparently they could tell because at first they walked away from it until they reluctantly ate it finally when they figured out that was all or nothing. Since they contribute nada to their food budget, I considered that even if I substituted it for every other 30-40lb bag & mixed it with another kibble I would still save $$. But reading all of the other reviews seemed like dogs either loved it, hated it, and/or it made them sick, I decided it just wasn’t worth continuing to buy it just to save money & chance the possibility it could  eventually make them sick. Or worse. Especially since they just did not like it. So they win and I’ll just work more overtime...The things we do for our fur babies...!

body: Quality food, reasonably priced and my smaller dogs love it. First off I’ll admit I’m not enough of an expert to rate the quality of the ingredients in this food. However I always research any dog food before I switch to see what actual experts say and make sure I’m not feeding my dogs something unhealthy or potentially harmful. I was satisfied with what I was able to find out about Wag so I gave it a try.What I can say is my three small dogs love this food. I have two Brussels Griffons and a pug who can be a picky eater and it’s not often I find something suitable for all three. I was a little concerned the pieces might be too big for the Brussels Griffons but they don’t seem to have any problem with it and my pug ate it without hesitation the very first time I gave it to them.If you have smaller dogs you know it can be a challenge finding the appropriate size food in bulk at a reasonable price. Food for toy breeds would be ideal but it’s typically sold in smaller sized bags at a premium cost. I love my dogs but there’s a limit to how much I can spend to feed them.So far so good with Wag. They’ve gone thru two 30 lb. bags of the “chicken and brown rice” recipe with no issues and I recently switched to “beef and lentil with wild boar” and they seem to love it just as much.Hopefully you’ll have great results as well and if you catch it on sale it’s definitely worth a try.

body: Makes my dogs sick to their stomachs Around Christmas time the food I normally feed my dogs was back ordered and as the ingredients on this food looked okay, I decided to try it for my two dogs. One of my dogs will eat anything, so she still scarfed her food right up but my other dog didn’t like this food at all and it was a struggle to get him to eat it. Despite tapering off their old food and introducing increasing quantities of this food over the course of a week and a half, both my dogs had extreme gastric distress and things smelled very unpleasant at our house for a few weeks. Thankfully we were able to purchase their regular food again but due to the upset to their systems caused by this food, they experienced a couple more weeks of stomach issues while transitioning back to their old food. I’ve changed their food various times over the years and I’ve never had it happen that stomach upset continues for a couple weeks even after discontinuing a food. If it were just one of my dogs I would assume they had an intolerance to an ingredient in the food, but since it really messed up both of my dogs’ stomachs I really wonder if this food could possibly be all that great. I also didn’t like how it’s all uniform little round kibble pieces. It could be that I’m used to different shapes and sizes as well as a salmon odor from their normal food, but this stuff doesn’t appear or smell like it would be any fun for a dog to eat. Based on my experience I can’t recommend this product but all dogs are different and maybe it will work for your dog.

body: VOMITING—3 dogs/3 diff breeds/3 diff ages DO NOT BUY. We have 3 rescue dogs. They range from age 2-14. We have used different dog brands throughout the years. I was frustrated with the clunky online ordering interface for a local pet store that made ordering really tough. We mixed our old dog food into this new dog food. We gave it over three weeks and our dogs kept randomly vomiting.  The picture of this dog food bag looks so modern and the ease of ordering from Amazon is so easy—but not worth it. If it helps —I took the time to leave this review to spare other dogs and dog owners—even though I have four children.

body: Bad reaction First the back story: I've got a finicky husky, and a shiba inu that will eat anything.  I try to rotate the dog foods so my husky doesn't get bored.  Neither dog takes more than a day to get digestively used to the dog food, and a 30 lb bag usually lasts about 35 days.For the first two weeks, my iron stomached husky had very loose, light colored wet poop, and my shiba had the same along with a yellowish vomit that smelled like the food.  The second two weeks have been better (i.e. occasional vomit, and light colored poop when eating only the food); however their food consumption is down by 30-40%, and I've had to add eggs, meat, and veggies to the food to encourage them to eat.It might be a bad batch, or just an ingredient doesn't agree with them, but I will not be returning to Wag.

body: I wouldn’t buy again Pups (4 of them) all seemed to like it for the first week or so then things started to go down hill quick from there. Started noticing a changing the stools from a normal health brown to a very light almost khaki color stool, after that one by one the pups started to puke the food up and/or in the mornings having bile like they are in need of food so I question the quality of ingredients! Last thing I started to notice is my pups would start skipping meals and wouldn’t only eat it if they had to type of thing so immediately changed them back to their normal quality brand. body: Has grains and probiotics/ Reasonable price I think this is a solid choice for dog food. The price is very reasonable. The food is made in California. The chicken is sourced from within the USA. The first few ingredients on the label are chicken, chicken meal and brown rice. It doesn’t have any preservatives, flavors or other junk ingredients. The kibble is medium-sized.The nutritional analysis is pretty similar to other good quality dog foods that we’ve tried; protein 24% min., fat 14% min, fiber 3% max., moisture 10% max. The food has grain which is a great change. There was a lot of hype around grain-free for a while. From what I know that’s been debunked. Plus, my vet was telling me that I should feed my dog food with grains so it was a no brainer for me.  I’m also seeing vitamins, minerals and probiotics on the label. I’ve noticed that probiotics really make a difference on my Lab Retriever’s health, specifically, she throws up less and her stools look healthy. I’m happy to see that there are many different strains of probiotic in the food.I followed the directions on the bag to gradually introduce my dog to the new food. The first couple nights that we started feeding her this food (with her old food) she threw up. I think it was because of the size of the kibble and that she eats too fast. I ended up splashing some warm water on the kibble and just the act of licking the sides of her bowl is helping her to slow her eating.Overall, I think this is a really GOOD CHOICE for dog food. It’s good quality and you’re NOT paying an arm and a leg for it.

body: Two of my three dogs enjoy this flavor WAG Salmon and Brown Rice Dog Food contains sustainably raised salmon as the first ingredient.  This is an Amazon brand that is made in the USA.  Some of the long list of ingredients come from other countries as is the case for many dog and human foods. I trust the Amazon statement that each batch is tested to ensure that it meets their high standards.This analysis for this blend is 22.5% crude protein, 14% crude fat, 3.5%crude fiber, 10% moisture and smaller amount of other vitamins and minerals including Taurine and Glucosamine which I find to be important additions.This kibble does not contain any of the ingredients that I avoid when choosing dog food, namely, chicken by-product meal, corn, wheat, soy, artificial colors, flavors or preservatives.Two of my three dogs really enjoy this flavor.  My picky dog is not a fan of fish but she will eat it though not with the gusto that she reserves for other flavors. None of the three had any digestive issues with this food.WAG Salmon and Brown Rice Dog Food is formulated for all life stages and is a healthy kibble with pieces that measure about a half inch in diameter which even most small dogs can manage.
subject: Amazon Brand – Wag Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 5 lb Bag

body: 🐺 Carnivorous Canines Rejoice! This proteinaceous, dry food source delivers a healthy meal option for dogs through the featured inclusion of 🐟 sustainably-raised salmon. With no added chicken by-products, corn components, or preservatives, it aims to deliver an easily digestible source of sustainment for your BFF (Best Furry Friend)!The main ingredients (listed in order of appearance) include: salmon, whole grain brown rice, chicken meal, barley, grain sorghum, rice bran, millet, dried yeast, chicken fat, beet pulp, flaxseed, salmon oil, blueberries, raspberries, and tomatoes! 🍅I have a 20-lb chiweenie, and she seems to enjoy this particular flavor and brand without any hesitation in consumption or evidence of digestive concerns. I would gladly recommend this WAG option to other pet owners like myself!
subject: Amazon Brand – Wag Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 5 lb Bag

body: Healthy Dog Food - made in the USA - dogs love it Made in the USA , this dry dogfood is full of sustainable ingredients dogs love.Number one is salmon, followed by whole grain brown rice. chicken meal, and barley.  Surprisingly, this dog food has beets, blueberries, flaxseed, tomatoes, and raspberries as well. Vitamins and minerals are added for a healthy, balanced dry dog food my dogs will eat.Mickey & Jack both enjoy eating. Recommended.If my review is helpful in any way, please click like.
subject: Amazon Brand – Wag Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 5 lb Bag

body: My picky dog loves this food This high quality dog food has reached a new fan.  My 14 year old poodle 🐩is a very picky eater but she has shown that she loves this food.She goes to the cabinet and scratches at the cabinet to be given more of this food.I can't deny her since it contains things that are all good for her.Highly recommended.

body: Dogs Love It This is a terrific dog food. The ingredients are clean. Salmon is the first on the list. The kibble i s the perfect size for dogs, small, medium and large to handle. It is low odor. My dogs eat it enthusiastically. I've observed no negative reactions to consumption. It seems soothing to those with sensitive stomachs. Perfect for pets and the people who love them.

body: Great food This is very good stuff. Ingredients are great and my dogs absolutely love this.
subject: Amazon Brand – Wag Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 5 lb Bag

body: Very small nuggets I have a couple of senior dogs who get easily bored eating the same foods day after day, so I supplement with different kibble varieties to keep their appetites up. They liked this food a lot (their usual kibble is not fish-based like this), they ate all of these pellets even though they left some of their regular pellets.One star off for the very tiny nugget size: probably suitable for little dogs, but my larger ones inhale these without even chewing. On the other hand, this is a good nugget size for filling “puzzle ball” feeders.
subject: Amazon Brand – Wag Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 5 lb Bag

body: Great flavor We introduced this to our dog as per the suggestion from Wag and mixed it in with her old food gradually. She likes this flavor.I did not give it a full 5 stars because I think there needs to be a way to reseal the package, especially with the way the bag is designed - cutting it open is awkward, and this seems to be an issue with most dog food companies.

body: the dogs like it The dogs love it when dog food comes in for them. They can smell the bag, so I don't waste time putting it away. They have eaten WAG food before. And they ate it until it was gone. They will do the same with this bag. They always find the salmon flavor extra good.
